Description: Ostracon, fragment from the body of a red-brown pottery vessel, interior slightly grooved, exterior covered with a light-brown slip and with remains of fifteen lines of Coptic text written in black ink, now faded in places, containing part of a letter.
Bibliographic references: Crum & Bell 1922 / Wadi Sarga: Coptic and Greek texts (p.88)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (87591) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/87591)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: O.Sarga 92 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
